body.name: MTYOKILN Magnetic Color & Number Maze - Montessori Wooden Color Matching Learning Counting Puzzle Board - Toddler Fine Motor Skills Toys for Boys Girls 3 4 5 Years Old
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 17. Order within 14 hrs 41 mins
features: Explore Colors and Counting: The magnetic toddler game features 55 magnetic beads in 10 distinct colors, with "ice cream " representing numbers 1-10. Great for improving fine motor skills and learning colors and numbers.

Magnetic Counting and Matching: Using the magnetic pen to move the beads from the track to the ice cream, children can practice color matching and counting skills while developing patience and focus. As the magnetic pen touches the beads, a magnetic force is transferred, causing them to connect. This physical phenomenon offers a fun and engaging way for children to learn and improve their ability to distinguish between individual beads.

Montessori-Inspired Learning: The magnetic maze board is a fun way for children to learn while playing, practicing counting, color recognition, hand-eye coordination, and fine motor skills. Keeps kids engaged for hours.The precision required to move the tiles through the maze helps develop dexterity and control, setting the foundation for more advanced motor skills later in life.

Premium Quality: Made of natural basswood with a smooth surface and non-toxic water-based paint. The high-quality acrylic sheet makes the board sturdy and durable, and the magnetic beads won't fall off and cause harm to children.

Perfect Gift for Preschoolers: The magnetic puzzle comes in an exquisite packaging, making it a perfect gift for toddlers, preschoolers, kindergarteners, and children aged 3-6. Ideal for birthdays, Christmas, New Year, or any holiday party. it's one of road trip must haves for kids

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Color Recognition Skill Each cone has its own color and 10 different colored beads. Children need to move the beads to match the colors to improve their color recognition Hand-eye Coordination Children develop their fine motor skills as they use the wand to move the beads to match colors. Counting & Number Learning Each ice cream has a corresponding color and number of beads, allowing children to learn counting and numbers while playing. Montessori Toy for Toddler This toddler toy fully develops your child's brain in many ways, improving their fine motor skills, thinking, imagination and creativity.

MTYOKILN Magnetic Color and Number Maze

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The design is very simple and so cute. I love how my four kids (1,3,6 and 8 y/o) take turns playing with this toy. With it they can learn colors, numbers and coordination. Great buy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great STEM activity for toddlers
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This is a great and mess free STEM activity for toddlers. Would be great for road trips as well. My 3 year old loves it. Also made well. I was concerned based on the images and little reviews available.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Magnets not strong
reviews.reviewText: Magnets don't hold up against the hand piece, dull weak grab. This makes it not enjoyable. However seller responded to my concern and addressed the issue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great “none screen time” activity
reviews.reviewText: Yay: My 3 year old loves playing with this. Even if they are unable to color sort or count it is still fun to move the beads around. Great to bring to dinner or play in car since it requires no extra pieces!This would make a great gift ages 2-5Nay: it’s large if you plan on putting in diaper bag. I left it in the car and while you drive you hear the beads roll around which is just annoying. My 3yr old also dropped it and scratched the front plastic. It’s still operational but a little disappointing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great gift for 4 yr old
reviews.reviewText: I love that it's easy to move the balls with the magnetic pen. My 4 year old loves this and I love that it teaches him his colors and sorting. I even caught myself playing with this toy...it brought back memories from when I was a kid. It's a classic toy that still delights.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Doesn’t get played with
reviews.reviewText: This toy is a cute idea, however it just doesn’t get played with I. Our house. After we sorted all of the boxes colors once or twice, it got really boring and repetitive. Also the magnet needs to be stronger.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and Fun
reviews.reviewText: Well made. Beads cannot come out. 3 Year Old Grands really enjoyed it. BUT...it was challenging to get them to understand that they needed to hold the pen upright for the magnet to work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My 4 year old loves this! I initially bought it for my 2.5 year old, but my older child loves it! It seems to be enhancing her fine motor skills, and promotes organization and color recognition! Highly recommend!
